content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 11 to node 13 in the given graph is:

11->7->14->13

Note that the path traverses nodes in the opposite order from the previous example, because you said that the endpoint of the path should be the previous point minus one. Therefore, the shortest path from node 11 to node 13 is 7 nodes longer than the shortest path from node 13 to node 11.

The shortest path from node 11 to node 14 in the given graph is:

11->7->9->14

Note that this path is slightly different from the previous question, because the endpoint you provided was different from the previous question's endpoint. In this case, the shortest path to node 14 involves node 14 itself.
